Director, Machine LearningUS-based candidates only & Eastern Time Zone/New YorkJob DescriptionOur client is looking for a talented Data Science & Machine Learning Leader to help build this vision. As Director of Machine Learning, you’ll lead a team focused on one of our most fundamental workflows; understanding and classifying data to provide value to our customers. In this role, you’ll report to the Chief Technical Officer and Chief Science Officer and help create the culture and environment by which we use cutting-edge AI + ML. This encompasses techniques such as deep neural networks, including neural graph networks, NLP techniques, and combining categorical features with textual features and graph networks, tree-based models, probability/likelihood estimation, and contextual multi-arm bandit problems. This strategic role for our organization enables us to provide meaningful value to real-world customers.ResponsibilitiesManage a cross-functional team of talented Data Scientists, Analysts, and Machine Learning Engineers responsible for the various modelsDefine data and machine learning technology standards, and oversee the training, mentorship, and performance of a world-class technology teamCollaborate and build strong relationships with Product and Customer Solutions stakeholders to understand requirements and prioritiesManage the evaluation and professional development of your organization.Contribute to a hiring process that attracts and retains world-class technology talent who can push the envelope of natural language processing, machine learning, and network analysisExperience RequiredBS or MS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or equivalent experienceYou have 10+ years of real-world professional experience building products based on Data Science & MLYou have a solid working knowledge of Supervised and Unsupervised Machine Learning with large and small datasets, Knowledge Graphs, Natural Language Processing, and Classification techniquesYou can manage a team of high-performing expertsYou have a strong sense of shared ownership and a collaborative dispositionYou have strong written and verbal communication skillsNice to have, but not requiredYou've worked with supply chain data, company data,Experience with container technologies like Docker and KubernetesWorking knowledge of cloud services like AWS, Azure, or GCPTechnologies we loveLanguages: Python, SQLTools: Tensorflow, XGBoost, Git, Kubernetes, Databricks, AWS, AzureDatastores: Postgres, DataBricks, ArangoDB
